application

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.Database

  • public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used to interact with the database. It is used to create the database, add, delete, and update players, and get player information. It is used directly in the class called AccountManager.java, which is static so each class can freely access the database. Example use: 
     
 Database db = new Database();
 db.addPlayer("John", "JDO", "password", "john@doe.com", 1);
 db.getPlayerID("John");
    Output: 
     Output: 1
    Since:
    1.0

      The constructor for the database.

      • addPlayer

        public int addPlayer(java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.String initials,
                     java.lang.String password,
                     java.lang.String email,
                     int ClassID)
        This method adds a player to the database. Also creates tables for all associated data.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the player.
        initials - The initials of the player.
        password - The password of the player.
        email - The email of the player.
        ClassID - The ID of the classroom the player chooses to join.
        Returns:
        int The ID of the player.
